Follow Your Money
Infrastructure Improvements Plan and Development Fee Report
In accordance with A.R.S. §9-436.05, the Draft Infrastructure Improvement Plan (IIP) and the Land Use Assumptions (LUA) are available for public review prior to the May 14th Council Meeting.
Notice Posted Date: March 5, 2019. View Report

Notice of Proposed Community Development Fee Schedule CPI Increase
In accordance with A.R.S. §9-499.15,  this notice and report are posting a 3.1% CPIU to the Community Development Fees Schedule and the adoption of ICC Building Valuation Data, Dated August 2018.
Notice Posted Date: February 6, 2019
A Reminder to Glendale Residents
The city’s new distracted driving ordinance takes effect Thursday February 7, 2019. At its January 8th meeting the Glendale City Council adopted a new ordinance banning the use of handheld electronic devices while operating a motor vehicle. This is a considered a primary offense meaning officers can pull you over for this violation alone. The fine for the first offense is $250.00. Officers will be contacting drivers in violation of the ordinance in order to educate and enforce the new rules. The city believes this an important measure to keep our streets safe and encourages all residents to avoid distractions caused by using handheld devices while driving. Use of such devices in hands-free mode is allowed. To read the full ordinance please click here  

Glendale Co-Hosts Free Fair Housing Workshops for Renters, Homebuyers & Landlords
Glendale Community Services, in partnership with Community Legal Services, is offering two free Fair Housing workshops during the month of April for Glendale renters, homebuyers and landlords. Each session will cover specialized information on housing laws and tenant-landlord rights and responsibilities under federal law. View Details

Glendale Renters & Homebuyers Workshop
Thursday, April 25, 2019, 3-5 p.m.
Glendale Main Library Large Meeting Room
5959 W. Brown Street, Glendale

Glendale Rental Housing Landlord Workshop
Saturday, April 27, 2019, 9-11 a.m.
Glendale Main Library Large Meeting Room
5959 W. Brown Street, Glendale
City of Glendale Seeking Board & Commission Members 
Are you a Glendale resident who is looking for a way to serve your community?  Consider applying for one of Glendale’s boards and commissions.  For a list of the City’s boards and commissions and to apply online, please go to www.glendaleaz.com/boardsandcommissions. 

For more information, contact the City Clerk’s Office at 623-930-2252.   
Celebrating Cesar Chavez
As Cesar Chavez's birthday approaches, City of Glendale employees celebrate his legacy. Watch Video
City Council Meeting Highlights: April 9
Want to know the latest news from Glendale’s City Council meeting on April 9?
Check this video out!
Mayor's State of the City Address 2019
I was proud to deliver Glendale’s 68th Annual State of the City Address and share exciting news of business growth including a big announcement complete with “wings.” Based on our citizen engagement and Glendale’s commitment to financial stability, public safety, quality of life, customer service and our streets, it’s plain to see why, “Everything’s Coming Up Roses.”
Watch Video | Press Release | 2019 Accomplishments
